channel.title: Looper project doesn't loop
channel.description: First off, hello to everybody. New to axoloti. I'm having a problem getting a beat sync'ed looper to actually loop. It just plays the sample once and stops. I got the basic patch off the forum, simplified it as best I could I could work with less clutter, somehow managed to beat sync it but now it doesn't loop anymore, have tried a lot of stuff, still can't seem to get it working. I think this would be valuable information in the future working with tables, so I'd really like to solve the problem.

item.title: Looper project doesn't loop
item.dc:creator: @Miami_Vice
item.description:
@Miami_Vice wrote:

Thanks, will check it out, might have already kind of solved it.

Read full topic

item.title: Looper project doesn't loop
item.dc:creator: @valmir
item.description:
@valmir wrote:

Rbrt Contributions

Blablabla.... @rbrt supplied us with another useful object -1shot- that solve also this... simpleloopermidiclkslave repitch.axp (17.3 KB) this idea start to be pretty solid, is it maybe time to get a second axo to slave to my other looping patch? I love this little thing!


Welcome!
That's a little patch from a long ago that should work. It uses a lot of community objects so if you are on firmware 2.0 something may not work.
As general info I'd say that something in your counter section is not ok, like 2 /change both triggering and resetting the counter, and to take a look at @rbrt objects... he's the looping hero!

Read full topic

item.title: Looper project doesn't loop
item.dc:creator: @Miami_Vice
item.description:
@Miami_Vice wrote:

First off, hello to everybody.

New to axoloti. I'm having a problem getting a beat sync'ed looper to actually loop. It just plays the sample once and stops.

looper-scrn.jpg941x449 68.3 KB

I got the basic patch off the forum, simplified it as best I could I could work with less clutter, somehow managed to beat sync it but now it doesn't loop anymore, have tried a lot of stuff, still can't seem to get it working.

I think this would be valuable information in the future working with tables, so I'd really like to solve the problem.

Read full topic
